From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

garantizar (first-person singular indicative present garantizo, past participle garantizáu)

  1. to guarantee

Conjugation

[edit]

infinitive garantizar
gerund garantizando
past participle m garantizáu, f garantizada, n garantizao, m pl garantizaos, f pl garantizaes

Related terms

[edit]
  • garantía

Further reading

[edit]
  • “garantizar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From garante (“guarantor”) +‎ -izar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ɡaɾantiˈθaɾ/ [ɡa.ɾãn̪.t̪iˈθaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /ɡaɾantiˈsaɾ/ [ɡa.ɾãn̪.t̪iˈsaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ga‧ran‧ti‧zar

Verb

[edit]

garantizar (first-person singular present garantizo, first-person singular preterite garanticé, past participle garantizado)

  1. to guarantee
    Synonym: (rare) garantir

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
